articles.title: Bitcoin electricity consumption drops by 43 per cent following crypto crash
articles.description: It is worth noting that despite the drop, the current energy consumption is equivalent to the amount of energy a country like Argentina uses yearly.
articles.content: The cryptocurrency market plunged by more than 50 per cent tanking hundreds of millions of dollars of crypto traders and investors. However, every event has a silver lining and the recent crypto crash also had a major impact on the energy consumption... [2179 chars]

articles.title: Roe v Wade overturned - What abortion access looks like around the world
articles.description: While countries like the US, Poland and Russia are taking steps backward, gains are being made in places such as Ireland, Colombia and Argentina.
articles.content: The global landscape of reproductive rights is constantly shifting. The US Supreme Court ruling that has overturned Roe v Wade – the landmark 1973 decision that protected a woman’s right to have an abortion – marks a significant regression for aborti... [5722 chars]

articles.title: VNL: Netherlands ends QC campaign with win over Argentina
articles.description: The Netherlands survived Argentina in a thriller, 22-25, 25-23, 20-25, 25-19, 15-13, to end its Quezon City campaign on a winning note in the VNL on Saturday.
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines-The Netherlands survived Argentina in a thriller, 22-25, 25-23, 20-25, 25-19, 15-13, to end its Quezon City campaign on a winning note in the Volleyball Nations League (VNL) on Saturday at Smart Araneta Coliseum.

articles.title: VNL: Netherlands outlasts Argentina in highly-charged five-set match
articles.description: Wessel Keemink steered the Netherlands to a highly-emotional win over Argentina
articles.content:
The Netherlands snagged a fiery five-setter against Argentina, 22-25, 25-23, 20-25, 25-19, 15-13, to claim its fifth win in the 2022 FIVB Volleyball Nations League, Saturday at the SMART Araneta Coliseum in Quezon City.
The win saw the Europeans at 5... [1775 chars]

articles.title: Latin America's leaders are waging 'war' on inflation; so far they're losing
articles.description: Brazil hiked rates last week and Argentina did a 300 basis point hike to 52% earlier in June. But inflation has continued to climb, hitting ordinary Latin Americans in a region where labor informality is high, food and fuel make up a huge chunk of family budgets and there is stark inequality.
articles.content:
Latin America's leaders have pulled no punches in the battle against inflation. The region has some of the highest interest rates in the world, with Mexico's central bank making a record rate hike this week. But so far they are losing.
While the worl... [3760 chars]

articles.title: Consistency is paramount for progress, says hockey coach Schopman ahead of World Cup
articles.description: It is crucial for performance. India finished a creditable third in their debut FIH Pro League season and Schopman said the recent back-to-back high-intensity matches against Belgium and Argentina augur well ahead of the World Cup.Pretty happy with our preparation.
articles.content:
Indian women's hockey team coach Janneke Schopman is stressing on consistency, without which, she said on Friday, the side will struggle to go far in the upcoming World Cup.
The quadrennial event will be jointly hosted by the Netherlands and Spain fr... [3194 chars]

articles.description: It began with a philanthropic couple buying a swamp but has become one of the world’s boldest experiments in restoring degraded habitats, bringing wildlife and landscapes back from the brink
articles.content:

articles.content:

articles.description: We're celebrating Lionel Messi's 35th birthday by taking a look back at certain aspects of his incredible career to date.
